Description: Lower body sherd of Milesian pootery oinochoe; exterior: yellowish-white slip; painted decoration consisting of probably two bands of leaves flanking central line; below, two brown bands.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Royal Ontario Museum, Toronto. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Hayes 1992 p. 208 no. N24. Kaufler pl. 32, 703-707.
Bibliographic references: Hayes 1992 / Greek and Greek-Style Pottery and Plain Pottery in the Royal Ontario Museum; Excluding Black-Figure and Red-Figure Vases (p. 208 no. N24)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.049)
